about.title: Welcome to UDOIT
about.description: The Universal Design Online content Inspection Tool (UDOIT) was created by the Center for Distributed Learning at the University of Central Florida. UDOIT will scan your course content, generate a report and provide instructions on how to correct accessibility issues. Funding for UDOIT was provided by a Canvas Grant awarded in 2014.
about.disclaimer: This tool is meant to be used as a guide, not a certification. It only checks for common accessibility issues, and is not comprehensive; a clean report in UDOIT does not necessarily mean that your course is fully accessible. Likewise, the tool may indicate a possible accessibility issue where one does not exist.
msg.no_permissions: You do not have permission to access the specified course.
msg.no_new_content: Course scan complete. No new content found.
msg.new_content: Course scan complete. New content has been added.
msg.sync.failed: Course scan failed. Course is missing.
msg.sync.course_inactive: Course scan failed. Course is inactive.
label.content_loading_msg: The course content is being reviewed.
label.review_only: This issue cannot be fixed within UDOIT. You can fix the issue in Canvas, or mark this as reviewed to hide this issue in the future.
label.replace.desc: Replace the current version of this file here.
label.admin.select_form: Select an account and term to filter your view
label.admin.name: Name
form.alt.msg.text_has_file_extension: Alt text cannot contain file extensions
form.alt.msg.text_matches_filename: Alt text cannot match file name
form.header.assistive_text: Use arrow keys to navigate options.
rule.label.AnchorLinksToMultiMediaRequir: Anchor Links To MultiMedia Require Transcripts
rule.label.AnchorLinksToSoundFilesNeedTr: Anchor Links To Sound Files Need Transcripts
rule.label.ContentTooLong: Content Length Should Not Exceed 3000 Words
rule.label.CssTextHasContrast: Insufficient Text Color Contrast With the Background
rule.label.ImageAltIsDifferent: Alternative Text Should Not Be the Image Filename
rule.label.ImageAltIsTooLong: Alternative Text Is More Than the Maximum Allowed Characters
rule.label.ImageAltNotEmptyInAnchor: Alt Text For Images Within Links Should Not Be Empty
rule.label.ImageAltNotPlaceholder: Alternative Text Should Not Be a Placeholder
rule.label.ImageGifNoFlicker: Avoid the Use of Animated GIFs
rule.label.ImageHasAltDecorative: Decorative Images Should Have Empty Alternative Text
rule.label.NoHeadings: Headings Should Be Used in Content
rule.label.TableHeaderShouldHaveScope: No Row or Column Scope Declarations Found in Table Headers
rule.label.VideoProvidesCaptions: Multimedia Objects Should Have a Text Equivalent
rule.desc.AnchorLinksToMultiMediaRequire: Multimedia objects should be accompanied by a link to a transcript of the content.
rule.desc.AnchorLinksToSoundFilesNeedTra:
Links to a sound file should be followed by a link to a transcript of the file.

Example

Wrong

<a href='interview.mp3'>Listen to the interview</a>

Right

<a href='interview.mp3'>Listen to the interview</a> <a href='transcript.html'>(transcript)</a>
rule.desc.AnchorMustContainText: Because many users of screen readers use links to navigate the page, providing links with no text (or with images that have empty 'alt' attributes and no other readable text) hinders these users.
rule.desc.AnchorSuspiciousLinkText: Links should be descriptive of the content they're linking to, such as 'Class Schedule' rather than 'schedule.html' or 'click here'.
rule.desc.BaseFontIsNotUsed: The basefont tag is deprecated and should not be used. Investigate using stylesheets instead.
rule.desc.BlinkIsNotUsed:
The blink tag should not be used. Ever.

Example

Wrong

<blink>Please read me!</blink>

Right

<strong>Please read me!</strong>
rule.desc.ContentTooLong: For content longer than 3000 words, consider splitting it up into multiple documents. This makes it easier for students to process and retain the information.
rule.desc.CssTextHasContrast: Text color should be easily viewable and should not be the only indicator of meaning or function. Color balance should have at least a 4.5:1 ratio for small text and 3:1 ratio for large text. Warning: using UFIXIT to fix one section of text may invalidate the contrast in nested sections of text that are not the same color.
rule.desc.CssTextStyleEmphasize: When emphasizing text, you may use color with sufficient contrast as long as you also apply some other form of emphasis, such as bold or italics. This ensures that screen reader users are aware of the text's importance.
rule.desc.DocumentReadingDirection: Changes in text direction in inline content should be indicated using any HTML element (for example, span) with a 'dir' attribute indicating left-to-right or right-to-left. For example, a Hebrew phrase within an english paragraph should have it's own text direction indicated.
rule.desc.EmbedHasAssociatedNoEmbed:
Because some users cannot use the embed element, provide alternative content in a noembed element.

Example

Wrong

<embed src='html.mov'/>

Right

<embed src='html.mov'/><noembed>A move with <a href='transcript.html'>an available transcript</a>.</embed>
rule.desc.FontIsNotUsed: The basefont tag is deprecated and should not be used. Investigate using stylesheets instead.
rule.desc.HeadersHaveText: Sighted and screen reader users depend on headings to organize the content on the page. Headings should not be empty and should represent an accurate outline of the content
rule.desc.ImageAltIsDifferent: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
rule.desc.ImageAltIsTooLong: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
rule.desc.ImageAltNotEmptyInAnchor: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
rule.desc.ImageAltNotPlaceholder:
The document title should not be wasted placeholder text which does not describe the page.

Example

Wrong

<html lang='en'><head><title>title</title></head><body>....

Right

<html lang='en'><head><title>All about salamanders</title></head><body>....
rule.desc.ImageGifNoFlicker: Animated GIFs may cause seizures if they flash more than 3 times per second. A recommendation is to use an alternative format to deliver the content.
rule.desc.ImageHasAlt: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
rule.desc.ImageHasAltDecorative: This image was marked as decorative in the Rich Content Editor, but the ALT attribute contains text. Please remove the alternative text.
rule.desc.ImageHasLongDescription:
Any image that has an 'alt' attribute that does not fully convey the meaning of the image should have a 'longdesc' attribute.

Example

Wrong

<img src='complexImage.png' alt='A complex image that cannot be described succinctly.'>

Right

<img src='complexImage.png' alt='A complex image that cannot be described succinctly.' longdesc='longer_description.html'>
rule.desc.InputImageNotDecorative:
Every form image button which has text within the image (say, a picture of the word 'Search' in a special font), should have the same text within the 'alt' attribute.

Example

Wrong

<input type='image' src='search.png' alt='A pretty picture'/>

Right

<input type='image' src='search.png' alt='Search this site'/>
rule.desc.MarqueeIsNotUsed:
The marquee element is difficult for users to read and is not a standard HTML element. Try to find another way to convey the importance of this text.

Example

Wrong

<marquee>This is really hard to read</marquee>

Right

<strong>This is much easier to read</strong>
rule.desc.NoHeadings: If appropriate, add headings to the page to organize the content for sighted and screen reader users. The headings should represent an accurate outline of the content
rule.desc.ObjectInterfaceIsAccessible: Object content should be assessed for accessibility. Objects cannot be checked using automated tools, this should be reviewed manually.
rule.desc.ObjectMustContainText: Multimedia objects should be accompanied by a link to a transcript of the content.
rule.desc.ObjectShouldHaveLongDescriptio: Objects might require a long description, especially if their content is complicated.
rule.desc.ObjectTagDetected: Multimedia embedded using the 'Object' tag may require the user to install a plugin for their web browser. This can create support and access issues for some users. Additionally, users on mobile devices may not be able to view the multimedia content at all. Consider using an alternative format that the user's browser can display natively.
rule.desc.ParagraphNotUsedAsHeader: Bold and Italics are used to emphasize text, whereas headings are used to define the structure of the document. Headings like h1-h6 are extremely useful for non-sighted users to navigate the structure of the page, and formatting a paragraph to just be big or bold, while it might visually look like a heading, does not make it one.
rule.desc.PreShouldNotBeUsedForTabularVa: If a pre element is used for tabular data, change the data to use a well-formed table.
rule.desc.TableDataShouldHaveTableHeader: Add a table header because it provides a description of the table structure for sighted and screen reader users.
rule.desc.TableHeaderShouldHaveScope: Scope declarations in headers organize and define table data by row/column for sighted and screen reader users.
rule.desc.VideoCaptionsMatchCourseLangua:
While this video has captions, there are no captions available for your course language. While not imperative to fix, if you'd like to you have three options:

  • Contact the creator of the video and request captions be added.
  • Create captions yourself using a service like Amara (http://amara.org/).
  • Find a different video that has closed captioning for your course language.
rule.desc.VideoEmbedCheck:
Videos used on online courses are required to have closed captioning. Unfortunately, automatic captioning (such as on YouTube videos) is not accurate enough for educational use. You have three options:

  • Contact the creator of the video and request captions be added.
  • Create captions yourself using a service like Amara (http://amara.org/).
  • Find a different video that has closed captioning.

(Please note that videos that have been removed, deleted, or are Unlisted will also cause this error, and will need to be manually verified.)
rule.desc.VideoProvidesCaptions:
Videos used on online courses are required to have closed captioning. Unfortunately, automatic captioning (such as on YouTube videos) is not accurate enough for educational use. You have three options:

  • Contact the creator of the video and request captions be added.
  • Create captions yourself using a service like Amara (http://amara.org/).
  • Find a different video that has closed captioning.
rule.desc.VideosEmbeddedOrLinkedNeedCapt: Captions should be included in the video to provide dialogue to users who are hearing impaired. (Please note that videos that have been removed, deleted, or are Unlisted will also cause this error, and will need to be manually verified.)
file.desc.pdf:
PDF Accessibility

Heading Text

PDF description goes here. PDF description goes here. P D F description goes here. PDF description goes here. PDF description goes here. P D F description goes here. PDF description goes here.

Heading Text

PDF description goes here. PDF description goes here. P D F description goes here. PDF description goes here. PDF description goes here. PDF description goes here. P D F description goes here. PDF description goes here. PDF description goes here. P D F description goes here.

Learn more at WebAIM.org: PDF Accessibility

errors.description: Because many users of screen readers use links to navigate the page, providing links with no text (or with images that have empty "alt" attributes and no other readable text) hinders these users.

Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.error: Decorative images should have empty alternative text.
errors.description: This image was marked as decorative in the Rich Content Editor, but the ALT attribute contains text. Please remove the alternative text.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.error: Alternative Text should not be the image filename
errors.description: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.error: Alternative Text is more than the maximum allowed characters
errors.description: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.error: Alt text for all img elements used as source anchors should not be empty
errors.description: Alternative Text (Alt Text) is an alternative (non-visual) way to describe the meaning of an image. Please provide a brief description of the image for a screen reader user. Note: It should not be the image file name.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.description: Add a table header because it provides a description of the table structure for sighted and screen reader users.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.error: No row or column scopes declarations found in headers of the table
errors.description: Scope declarations in headers organize and define table data by row/column for sighted and screen reader users.
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

errors.error: Insufficient text color contrast with the background
errors.description: Text color should be easily viewable and should not be the only indicator of meaning or function. Color balance should have at least a 4.5:1 ratio. Warning: using UFIXIT to fix one section of text may invalidate the contrast in nested sections of text that are not the same color.

errors.error: Multimedia objects should have text equivalents (e.g., transcripts).
errors.description: Multimedia objects should be accompanied by a link to a transcript of the content.

suggestions.suggestion: Avoid the use of animated GIF’s
suggestions.description: Animated GIFs may cause seizures if they flash more than 3 times per second. A recommendation is to use an alternative format to deliver the content.

Closed captions should be included in the video to provide dialogue to users who are hearing impaired. (Please note that videos that have been removed, deleted, or are Unlisted will also cause this error, and will need to be manually verified.)
resources: Creating Captions for Video Uploaded to Canvas

suggestions.suggestion: Closed captions do not match course language.
suggestions.description: Closed captions that match the course language should be included in the video to provide dialogue to users who are hearing impaired. (Please note that videos that have been removed, deleted, or are Unlisted will also cause this error, and will need to be manually verified.)
resources: Creating Captions for Video Uploaded to Canvas

suggestions.suggestion: Content length should not exceed 3000 words.
suggestions.description: For content longer than 3000 words, consider splitting it up into multiple documents. This makes it easier for students to process and retain the information.
Links should be descriptive of the content they're linking to, such as "Class Schedule" rather than "schedule.html" or "click here".

suggestions.suggestion: The text equivalents (e.g., transcripts and/or captions) for embedded content should update when content changes.

suggestions.description: Sighted and screen reader users depend on headings to organize the content on the page. Headings should not be empty and should represent an accurate outline of the content

suggestions.suggestion: Consider adding headings to your document to create more structure
suggestions.description: If appropriate, add headings to the page to organize the content for sighted and screen reader users. The headings should represent an accurate outline of the content
resources: UCF CDL: Text Formatting and Document Organization

suggestions.suggestion: Avoid using styles for document structure
suggestions.description: Bold and Italics are used to emphasize text, whereas headings are used to define the structure of the document. Headings like h1-h6 are extremely useful for non-sighted users to navigate the structure of the page, and formatting a paragraph to just be big or bold, while it might visually look like a heading, does not make it one.

suggestions.suggestion: Avoid using color alone for emphasis
suggestions.description: When emphasizing text, you may use color with sufficient contrast as long as you also apply some other form of emphasis, such as bold or italics. This ensures that screen reader users are aware of the text's importance.
resources: <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H49.html">WCAG 2.0 Technique: H49: Using semantic markup to mark emphasized or special text</>

translations.scanning_message: Please stay on this page while UDOIT scans your course content.
